The Buddha understands the five aggregates as originally non-existent; one should contemplate the various sutras according to their origins.
Practitioners should further contemplate the five aggregates that are the basis of the body.
Form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness - these are called the five aggregates.
It is like a city with several households, combined east, west, south, and north to form a city.
Form is also like this, not just one form is called the aggregate of form;
Feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are also like this.
Not just one consciousness is called the aggregate of consciousness, there are ten sense bases, or form and dharma observation, which is called the aggregate of form.
Eight hundred feelings and pleasures are called the aggregate of feeling, and the aggregates of perception, mental formations, and consciousness each have eight hundred, which are called aggregates.
Understanding the basis of the five aggregates should also be like this.
Here is the verse:

It is like a great city, with several households called form.
Not just one form is form, there are ten forms of sense bases,
There are eight hundred feelings, and perception and formation are also like this.
The wise one understands this dharma, and the various are called aggregates.
Distinguishing and knowing they are not one, is what the practitioner should contemplate.
Combining and connecting various things, using detached wisdom, speaking and abandoning the Buddha's teachings,
Practicing ignorance and not clearly understanding, it is like a tree with many branches and leaves,

Those who cultivate should understand the characteristics of the five aggregates.
How does one know the characteristics of the five aggregates?
Having light is form, having an appearance is also form, what is grasped by the hand is also called form, if shown to others, it is also form.
Habituation to pleasure is feeling, neither pleasure nor pain is also feeling, this is called the perception of feeling.
The characteristics of consciousness are perception, whether male, female, or other things, this is called perception.
To create is called action, whether it is good action, bad action, or neither good nor bad, this is called action.
To understand is called consciousness, whether it is good, not good, not having good, or not having not good, to understand this is called consciousness.
Thus, each understands the characteristics of the five aggregates.

Those who practice should discern and understand the origin of the five aggregates.
What is meant by understanding the origin of the five aggregates?
It is like a string of pearls dropped at a four-way intersection. When a person sees it, they are delighted in their mind and want to go and pick it up.

The person sees the string of pearls with their eyes and considers it to be the aggregate of form, they take pleasure in it and consider it to be the aggregate of feeling, when they first see it they recognize it as a string of pearls and call it the aggregate of perception, the person's intention to take the string of pearls is considered the aggregate of mental formations, discerning the string of pearls is considered the aggregate of consciousness. In this way, there are five aggregates.

In this way, the five aggregates are like a string of pearls, simultaneously arising together, creating various actions. If they arise from the mind, like a string of pearls, they simultaneously arise together, withdrawing from the five aggregates.

It is the same for all people. The five aggregates seen by the eyes all arise from this. In the same way, the sounds heard by the ears, the smells smelled by the nose, the tastes tasted by the tongue, the sensations felt by the body, and the mental phenomena in the mind - the four aggregates in the mind are the formless aggregate.
This is how to distinguish the basis of the five aggregates.

It is like when a person's life is about to end, because their lifespan is about to be exhausted, the four hundred and four illnesses in that person's body gradually approach from the front and back, and they then have many dreams and see strange omens, and they become frightened;

They dream of black bees, crows, and vultures perched on their heads, and they see a crowd of people in a hall above them having fun, wearing clothes of blue, yellow, white, and black, riding a wild donkey and then crying out;
They dream of pillowing a large dog and also a monkey, and lying on the ground;
They dream of eating from the same vessel as a dead person, a butcher, and a sewer cleaner, and going on an excursion together;
Or they dream of pouring sesame oil and ghee over their body and also eating it, doing so many times;
They see a snake coiling around their body and dragging them into the water;
Or they dream of seeing their own body jumping for joy, clapping their thighs and laughing playfully;
Or they see themselves adorned with flowers falling into ashes, and using the ashes to dust their bodies and then eating it;
Or they see ants crawling over their bodies;
Or they see themselves chewing salt, chased by dogs and monkeys, each biting back at them;
Or they see themselves marrying and worshipping household deities, seeing their houses collapse and shrines destroyed;
They dream of plowing, with the plow falling on their beard and hair;
Sometimes their teeth fall out on the ground, and they wear white lay clothes;
Or they see themselves walking barefoot, smeared with sesame oil, rolling in the dirt;
They dream of wearing fur and tattered clothes;
They dream of others riding dilapidated carts to their door, wanting to welcome them away;

Or they see various flowers, boiling oil, and incense, relatives taking them to adorn their bodies, ancestors appearing with a bluish-black complexion, calling them forward to grab and drag them, having these dreams repeatedly;
Wandering in the cemeteries, picking up flower garlands, and seeing red lotus flowers falling on his neck, falling into the great river and being carried away by the water;
Dreaming of falling into the water of the five lakes and nine rivers, unable to reach the bottom;
Or seeing his body entering various groves, without flowers or fruits, being hooked and damaged by thorns and brambles, with tiles and stones pressing down on his body;
Or seeing withered trees with no branches or leaves, dreaming of climbing on them and playing alone, dancing on the temple altar;
Or seeing groves, enjoying himself alone in the midst of them, laughing with joy, picking withered branches and carrying them away;
Or entering a dark room, not knowing the exit;
Also climbing mountains and cliffs, not knowing the way out;
Again seeing the mountain collapse, pressing down on his body, crying and wailing;
Or seeing a herd of elephants suddenly coming and trampling on his body;
Dreaming of dirt and dust covering one's body and head, or wearing tattered clothes while walking through a vast wilderness;
Dreaming of riding a tiger and running wildly, or riding a donkey or dog and wandering south;
Entering a cemetery to collect charcoal, nails, and hair, seeing one's own body wearing withered flowers, being led into a great mountain, and seeing King Yama.
Then, there is a verse:
Living in the world with much comfort and ease, one is not afraid until the end of life arrives;
When afflicted by illness, one is distressed and not in control.
The mind is hot and worries arise, seeing dreams and harboring fear,
Just like a wicked person being chased, worries and fears are like this.
When the person wakes up, their mind is filled with fear and their body trembles in terror. They calculate that their life is about to end, and have no doubt:
The dreams I have had have never happened before.

Because of this urgency, his hair stood on end, and his illness became so severe that he shook and was uneasy, like a fierce elephant when a herd suddenly arrives and tramples him like a plantain tree. His illness became so severe that he was confined to bed, just like this.
He was desperate and had no plan, so he sought to return to the doctor. His brothers and relatives saw him in such distress and sent someone to call the doctor. The person they sent

had a dirty body, tattered clothes, long fingernails, a torn umbrella, worn-out wooden clogs on his feet, and rode in a dilapidated cart. His complexion was dark, his eyes were blue, and he often used his hands to rub his beard and hair.
The oxen he drove were either blue or black, and there was also a pure white one.
He urgently called the doctor to come and ride in the cart.

indulging in desires without ever thinking of the doctor.
and is confined to bed and seat,ğŸ”½only then does he invite a doctor,
hoping to be cured of his illness.
At that time, the doctor observes with his mind that the patient will certainly die.
Why is this?

He sees this strange response, the appearance, voice, and demeanor of the person who came, holding a broken umbrella, with disheveled beard, nails, and hair, and also the evil day, such as the fourth, sixth, twelfth, or fourteenth day, all of which are inauspicious. The doctor is immediately displeased, as it is a day prohibited by the sages and saints, and he misses the right time due to the stars.
The doctor thinks to himself:
Although I encounter these strange stars, good or bad, I can still treat them.
Why is this?
Although there are patients who can be cured through skillful means, if their life span is not yet exhausted, they can be cured, but if the end is near, I cannot cure them.
Based on these words, it is not necessarily dependent on good days, stars, and auspiciousness or inauspiciousness. Therefore, a wise person does not seek an auspicious time based on the calendar.
The immortals always say:
'One should seek skillful means.
' If someone with a wind or cold illness has not yet exhausted their life, they may have an untimely death. This can be treated.
If their life is about to end, there is nothing that can be done.
Even so, going to treat them is still better than not going.
The doctor, having thought this, then got up and wanted to leave.
Then, there is a verse:
It is like two people who set out together to enter the ocean,
One may reach the other shore, while the other may be cut off in the middle.
Falling into the ocean of illness is also like this,
If at times one recovers from illness, there may be another who dies.

Then, when the doctor arrived at the patient's home, he heard evil omens such as the sounds of loss, burning, destruction, cutting, peeling, pulling out, frightening, dragging away, setting out, and restraining, which he interpreted as incurable and fatal.

In the south, a fox howled, or he heard the sounds of a crow or an owl, or he saw small children smearing each other with dirt, standing naked, pulling each other's hair, breaking jars, vases, bowls, and other utensils;
having seen these changes, he examined the patient in front, who was weak and lying in bed.
Then, he spoke in verse:
The doctor observed the patient's appearance, startled and uneasy,
either sitting, standing, or lying in bed, agitated and hot as if his skin were burning.
Having seen this, the doctor thought to himself:
According to my examination of the scriptures, this is a case of death.

His facial expression is alarmed, his eyelashes are disheveled, his body is emaciated, saliva comes out of his mouth, his eyes are dim, his nostrils are sunken, his complexion loses its color, he does not hear sounds or smells, his lips are chapped, his tongue is dry, his appearance is like the earth, his hundred meridians are straight and blue, his hair stands on end, he grabs his hair and pinches his nose, but feels nothing, his breathing is uneven, sometimes slow and sometimes fast.
Then, he spoke a verse:
His facial expression changes, and his hair stands on end.
He stares straight ahead as he thinks, and his tongue forcefully reveals strange things.
The sick person has these signs, and only a little life remains.
He is surrounded by the fire of illness, like burning grass and trees.

If he bathes or does not bathe,

Even if good incense, agarwood, sandalwood, root incense, and flower incense are burned, the scent of these various incenses is truly good, but the sick person smells it as if burning the stench of dead human bones, hair, fur, nails, skin, fat, marrow, or excrement, or as the stench of owls, vultures, foxes, dogs, rats, snakes, or vipers.

The sick person's voice changes, speaking like broken pottery, appearing as if the throat is blocked, the sound sometimes like that of a crane, goose, peacock, cow, horse, tiger, wolf, or the sound of thunder or a drum;

The person's disposition changes, not being constant, sometimes appearing upright and beautiful, the body soft, or sometimes rough and hard, the body changing frequently, sometimes light, sometimes heavy, losing one's wishes.
These various strange occurrences, for those whose lives are to end, each encounters some of these things, not all of them.
Here is the verse:
Seeing various changes, with afflictions pressing on the body,
The mind is filled with fear and terror, encountering misfortune like this.
Human nature is ruined like this, with bodily changes of not one kind,
Like the fruits of bamboo and reeds, born by themselves and naturally decaying.
Now what I have learned, as I have heard and known, is the strange changes that appear when a person is about to die:
The mouth does not know taste, the ears do not hear sounds, the sinews and blood vessels constrict and tighten, and breathing is irregular;
The body aches and moans, blood and qi are subtle, the body becomes emaciated, and the sinews appear coarse;
Or the body suddenly becomes fat, with bulging blood vessels, the cheeks hanging down, the head shaking, it is repulsive to look at, and movements are slow;
The pupils of the eyes are much darker than usual, the eyes do not see, urination and defecation are obstructed, the joints are about to disintegrate, and the senses are unstable;
The eyes and mouth are all blue, and the qi is knotted and connected with panting.
All the strange changes manifested like this.
Then, he spoke in verse:
The illnesses are countless, with blood vessels and vital energy exhausted,
Like water gnawing at the roots of a tree, one should pity them as if pulling out a blade.
At that time, the doctor thought to himself:
There is such an illness, and death is certain.

The stars revolve around, and human birth is also like this,
The ruler has something to fear, and there are many dangers.
Those who compose this sutra, all in order to solve their problems,
Just as the Buddha, with the true Dharma, removes ignorance and allows one to see the light.
Even if all these doctors, magicians, poisoners, and shamans were to gather together, they would not be able to cure him and prevent his death.
Here is a verse:
Creating offenses and afflictions, suffering and harboring various troubles,
Illness and pain disturb one's thoughts, with much defilement, life is shortened.

The heavenly emperor and various spirits cannot save one, let alone me.
The doctor thought to himself:
As long as life has not ended, I should avoid and retreat.
He then said to the people:
Now, for this patient, if there is anything he requests, such as delicious food, give it to him as he wishes, do not go against him!
I have urgent matters and will leave you for a while, when I finish I will return.

Here is a verse:
When life is about to end, one falls gravely ill,
and together with the afflictions, one's sins become manifest.
Strange transformations arise naturally, and one encounters extreme heat and cold,
even if one holds a vajra, one cannot save one's life.

At that time, when the patient's family members, both young and old, hear the doctor's words, they immediately abandon the decoctions and spells, and the patient's family members, relatives, clansmen, neighbors, close friends, and acquaintances all gather, surround the patient, grieve and cry, and watch as the patient suffers.
It is like a butcher's pen where pigs are caught and about to be killed. The other pigs all gather, frightened, listening with ears pricked up, staring in bewilderment;

it is like a pack of fierce tigers catching a cow. The other cows, seeing this, run away in fear, some entering mountain cliffs, some jumping into deep valleys, and some hiding among trees, jumping and roaring;
It is like a fisherman holding a net to catch fish, the other fish see it and scatter in fear, sinking to the bottom of the rocks and grass;
It is also like a hawk swooping down on a flock of birds, catching one, the other birds see it and fly away in all directions.
That person is like this, when impermanence arrives, their body disintegrates and scatters, family and relatives think of parting, grieving like this.

When life is about to end, the messengers of King Yama naturally come, when they arrive they see the bound person shot by iron arrows, pulled by sins to the boat of birth and death, and want to set off immediately.
Family members surround them, their hair let loose, grieving and wailing, dust and dirt on their face, crying and sighing, tears streaming down their face, all saying:
Alas!
How can we part from each other?
Beating their chests, lamenting, praising the patient's various virtues, their hearts filled with distress.
Then, in verse:
When a person is afflicted with illness and suffering, their body cold and emaciated, hot and feverish,
The entire family gathered, raising their voices in sorrowful lamentation.
Creating karma, one experiences suffering and joy, like a bee collecting the taste of flowers,
The mind then experiences sorrow and distress, and the entire family is afflicted.
The person's illness is like this. A wind called knife arises in the body, causing the joints of the sick person to disintegrate.
There is a wind called cutting, which severs all the joints;ğŸ”½There is a wind called shaking, which causes the sinews and vessels to slacken;
There is a wind called breaking bones, which consumes the marrow of the sick person;
There is a wind called diminishing, which changes their complexion, and the eyes, ears, nose, mouth, throat, and other orifices all turn blue, cut off and destroyed, flaying the body;

There is another wind called stopping the sides, which causes the inside of the body, as well as the knees, shoulders, sides, back, spine, abdomen, intestines, large and small intestines, liver, lungs, heart, spleen, and other organs, to all be severed;
There is a wind called revolving, which causes the fat, blood, feces, intestines, and stomach to be blocked, and cold and heat to dry up.

There is a wind called interval, which causes the limbs to either contract or stretch, raising the hands and feet to grasp at empty space, sitting up in confusion, sometimes laughing and playing, and also greatly sighing, with a sound of distress, the joints breaking one by one, the muscles and blood vessels slackening, the marrow and brain dissolving, the eyes not seeing forms, the ears not hearing sounds, the nose not distinguishing scents, the mouth not knowing tastes, the body cold and breath ceasing, with nothing further to recognize, the lower heart still warm, the soul and spirit continuing, stiff and straight like wood, unable to move or shake.
Then, in verse, it says:
When the knife-wind arises, the body moves much and is uneasy.
All conditions arrive universally, but one is not aware of it oneself.
The body undergoes various afflictions, and then life is exhausted.
Just as a bow or crossbow string, loose or tight, cannot be used.
At that time, the person's mind is surrounded by the four great elements, all decaying, and the feeble life is like a lamp about to go out.

In the person's mind, there is the bodily faculty. What they have done, good or evil, the mind immediately thinks of the blessings and misfortunes, good and bad, of this and future lives, and the mind fully knows what should be done. Those who practice goodness have a harmonious complexion, while those who do evil have an unpleasant appearance.
If the person's mind is joyful, their complexion will be good. Know that they will definitely go to the good paths;
If their complexion is bad and their thoughts are not good, they will go to the evil paths.

It is like an old person looking into a clear mirror, seeing their own form with white hair, wrinkled face, lost teeth, sores, dirt, black ugliness, loose skin, hunched back, and trembling with old age;
If they see this, they will feel ashamed and hide it, closing their eyes and putting down the mirror.
My youth has passed,
and old age is approaching. I am worried and anxious, having left behind peace and security and fallen into hardship.
Those who have previously engaged in evil deeds, when their life is about to end, will see evil transformations, be sorrowful and terrified, and deeply reproach themselves:
I will definitely fall into the evil realms, there is no doubt.
It is like an old person looking in a mirror and seeing their body, knowing that old age has arrived.
Then, there is a verse:
Gold, jewels, and other things are made by skillful and unskillful craftsmen,
If one engages in evil deeds, they will sink into the deep abyss.
Even if they sink and are reborn, they will look around without support,
Like being swept away by water, they will die like this.
Those who practice good deeds are of three levels, subsuming body, speech, and mind, purifying various virtues, taking the Dharma as wealth. When facing the end of life, the mind is filled with joy:
I will definitely ascend to the heavens.
It is like a merchant who travels far to do business, passes through difficult paths, obtains much wealth and profit, and returns home with immeasurable joy in his heart;
It is also like a farmer who does not miss the plowing season, and with timely wind and rain, harvests abundant grains, storing them in the granary with great satisfaction;
It is like a sick person who recovers and is able to repay debts, and the mind is filled with joy in the same way.
It is like a bee collecting flowers to make honey. Accumulating virtue is also like this. The mind is greatly delighted:
I will definitely ascend to the heavens!
Then, he spoke in verse:
Those who study the true Dharma, accumulate and practice the true Dharma,
Can transcend various afflictions and attain the path of enlightenment by themselves.
It is like a person in a secluded place, looking down from a high mountain,
When that person's life is about to end, they see the good path like this.
At that time, when the person's life is already exhausted, the body's faculties and consciousness cease, and they immediately experience the intermediate state;
It is like a scale, following the lightness or heaviness, either going up or down. Good and evil are like this.
The spirit leaves the human body and abides in the intermediate state, fully endowed with the five aggregates, lacking nothing.
At the time of death, the five aggregates do not reach the intermediate state, and the five aggregates of the intermediate state are also not separate from the original.
It is like using a seal to stamp mud. The seal does not stick to the mud, nor is it separate from it;
It is like planting five grains, and the seedlings grow into stalks and fruits, which are not the original seeds, yet are also not separate from the original.
In this way, when a person dies, the spirit and soul do not equal the five aggregates, yet are also not separate from the original.

According to the seeds they have planted, they each receive their corresponding fruits and retributions. Those who have cultivated virtue abide in the realm of goodness, while those who have practiced evil abide in the realm of sin. Only the eye of the Way can see this.
Abiding in the realm, there are three kinds of food:
First, soft touch; second, mental food; third, mental consciousness.

Those who abide in the realm may stay for one day, up to seven days, until they meet with their parents, following their original conduct, they may go to the three evil paths, the human realm, or the heavens.

Those who have done much evil, while abiding in the realm, see a great fire arise, surrounding their bodies, like wild fires burning grass and trees, dust raining down on their forms. They see crows, vultures, and evil people with long claws and teeth, ugly faces, tattered clothes, their heads on fire, each holding weapons to beat and stab them. Spears pierce and swords cut, their hearts are filled with fear;
Desiring to seek rescue, they see a clump of trees in the distance and run towards it, but then lose consciousness and stop in the five aggregates.
Entering the hell of sword trees, the spirits of those who fall into hell see this.
Here is a verse:
Deluded like a drunken elephant, going against the teachings of the sages,
Turbid like muddy water, the mind is confused like this;
Always abandoning the right path, letting the mind enter the wrong path,
This person encounters many sufferings, and when life ends, falls into hell.

Those who commit minor evil deeds see fire, smoke, and dust surrounding and filling their bodies, and being chased by lions, tigers, wolves, snakes, and herds of elephants, and also see old canals, springs, deep water, collapsed mountains, and large ravines. Frightened, they rush into them, and then lose consciousness and stop in the five aggregates.
Falling into the realm of animals, seeing these changes, they know they will receive an animal body.
Then, a verse says:
Cultivating ignorance and abandoning wisdom, one may become intoxicated and fall into the dark path,
With evil speech always speaking harshly, delighting in beating and striking others,
And also committing offenses and calamities, enjoying doing unwholesome things,
Thus, those without compassion are born among the animal realm.

If the offenses are slight, hot winds arise all around, the body is filled with heat, naturally hungry and thirsty, seeing people from afar all holding knives, staffs, spears, bows and arrows surrounding them, hoping to see a great city and enter it;
As soon as this thought arises, they lose the five aggregates they were receiving while resting.
Being born in the hungry ghost realm, seeing such changes, one should know that they have fallen into the realm of hungry ghosts.
Then, a verse says:ğŸ”½Being stubborn and delighting in slandering others, keeping away from precepts and not following the Dharma,
Violating prohibitions and defiled matters, greedily eating alone;
Falling into a place of pus and blood, hungry and thirsty, extremely troubled,
One should know that these people will definitely enter and become hungry ghosts.

If one cultivates virtue and goodness, cool breezes come from the four directions, the breezes are very fragrant, and various kinds of incense rain down on one's body. The sounds of various musical instruments harmonize and play. Looking at the gardens, trees, flowers, and fruits, they are all lush and luxuriant;
If one wishes to go there, one immediately loses [one's way] and stops in the five aggregates. The spirit naturally ascends to the Heaven of the Thirty-three.
Here is the verse:
Cultivating the Dharma returns to the noble path, planting meritorious karma and being born in the heavens,
Enjoying music and entertainment, roaming among the flowers and trees,
Beautiful and fragrant jade maidens, upright and radiant,
Always observing with a joyful mind, dwelling on the peak of Mount Tai.
If one's conduct is not pure and consistent, sometimes good and sometimes evil, one will go to the human realm.
When the parents come together, and the essence is not lost at the right time, the child should be born.

If the parents have virtuous thoughts and are together at the same time, and the mother's womb is unobstructed, if she is joyful and free from deviant thoughts, then she will be gentle and not stubborn, free from illness and able to receive the child;
if she is not contemptuous and does not act contrary, if she follows the right Dharma and does not accept defilement, then she will abandon all dust of faults and impurities.

If the essence is neither unclear nor turbid, moderately strong, not rotten or spoiled, not red or black, not affected by wind, cold, or various poisons, and is separate from urine, then the spiritual essence of one who is to be born will enter.
Thinking to oneself:
If this is a man who is not with a woman, I wish to be with him.
Giving rise to angry thoughts and resenting that man, with a respectful attitude thinking of the woman, anger and joy acting together, pushing the man towards the woman;
The father's essence is subtle, and the spirit rejoices, thinking it is mine.
At that time, it immediately loses the five aggregates in the middle and enters the womb.
The parents' essence combines, and after being in the womb, it is even more joyful. It is not the five aggregates in the middle, nor is it apart from them.

Entering the womb is the form aggregate, the time of joy is the feeling aggregate, thinking of the essence is the perception aggregate, due to past merits and demerits one enters the womb, this is the formation aggregate, the spirit dwelling in the womb corresponds to the consciousness aggregate. Such a combination is called the five aggregates.
Soon after being in the womb, one obtains two faculties, the mental faculty and the body faculty.

For seven days, it stays in the middle without increasing or decreasing;ğŸ”½After another twenty-one days, the fetus gradually turns, like thin yogurt;ğŸ”½By the twenty-first day, it resembles fresh yogurt;
After another twenty-eight days, the essence coagulates like ripe yogurt;ğŸ”½When in the womb, one obtains two faculties, the mental faculty and the body faculty.
By the fifth and seventh days, the fetal essence transforms like fresh butter;ğŸ”½Again, by the sixth and seventh days, it transforms like a lump of flesh;
By the seventh and seventh days, it turns like a piece of meat;
Again, by the eighth and seventh days, it becomes as hard as a clay pot;
By the ninth and seventh days, it transforms into five blisters, the two elbows, two knees, and its neck, which emerge from within;
Again, by the seventeenth day, there are five more blisters, the wrists, ankles, and its head is born;
By the eleventh and seventh days, twenty-four more blisters are born, the fingers, toes, eyes, ears, nose, and mouth, which emerge from within;
By the twelfth and seventh days, these various blister-like features are fully formed;
By the thirteenth and seventh days, the abdominal features appear;
By the fourteenth and seventh days, the liver, lungs, heart, and spleen are born;
By the fifteenth and seventh days, the large intestine is born;
By the sixteenth and seventh days, the small intestine is present;
At seventeen weeks, the stomach appears;
At eighteen weeks, the raw and cooked intestines form;
At nineteen weeks, the thighs, knees, intestines, ribs, palms, soles, forearms, and tendons develop;
At twenty weeks, the genitals, navel, breasts, chin, neck, and facial features form.

At twenty-one weeks, the body bones divide according to their proper locations. Two bones are in the head, thirty-two bones are in the mouth, seven bones are in the neck, two bones are in the thighs, two bones are in the elbows, four bones are in the forearms, twelve bones are in the chest, eighteen bones are in the back, two bones are in the hips, four bones are in the knees, forty bones are in the feet, and one hundred and eight tiny bones merge with the body flesh. The eighteen bones are in the two sides, and two bones are in the shoulders. Thus, there are three hundred bones in the body, which are connected to each other. The bones are soft like newly grown gourds;
On the twenty-second week, the bones become slightly firmer, like an unripe gourd;
On the twenty-third week, the bones become even firmer, like a walnut. These three hundred bones

are connected to each other, with the foot bones connected to the feet, the knee bones connected to the knees, the ankle bones connected to the anklesğŸ”½, the thigh bones connected to the thighs, the hip bones connected to the hips, the spine bones connected to the spine, the chest bones connected to the chest
, the rib bones connected to the ribs, the lip bones connected to the lips, the neck, chin, arms, wrists, hands
, and the bones of the feet are connected to each other, like a gathering of illusory bones, and also
like a chariot assembled with bones as walls, bound by sinews, flowing with blood, wrapped in skin and flesh, covered with thin skin,
and due to past misdeeds and merits, one attains this, without any thought relying on one's mind
, following the wind that pulls and moves it.
Here is the verse:
The five bones accumulate, following the mind, lightly indulging,
The body is present, with convulsions, like pulling a snake;
The actions created in past lives, the laws arising from good and evil,
Are like a person walking on a road, sometimes flat, sometimes thorny.
On the twenty-fourth seven-day period, seven hundred sinews are born, connecting to the body;
On the twenty-fifth seven-day period, seven thousand blood vessels are born, still not fully formed;
On the twenty-sixth seven-day period, all the blood vessels are fully developed and complete, like the pores of a lotus root;
On the twenty-seventh seven-day period, the 363 sinews are all formed;
On the twenty-eighth seven-day period, the flesh begins to grow;
On the twenty-ninth seven-day period, the flesh becomes slightly thicker;
On the thirtieth seven-day period, there is just skin and a form;
On the thirty-first seven-day period, the skin becomes thicker and firmer;
On the thirty-second seven-day period, the skin becomes fully formed;
On the thirty-third seven-day period, the ears, nose, lips, fingers, and knees are formed;
On the thirty-fourth week, 990,000 pores are formed, but the hair pores are still not complete;
On the thirty-fifth week, the pores are complete;
On the thirty-sixth week, the nails are formed.
On the thirty-seventh week, various winds arise in the mother's womb. Some winds open the child's ears, eyes, nose, and mouth;
Some winds color the hair, some are upright and some are ugly;
There are also winds that form the body's complexion, which may be white, red, or black, and may be good or ugly, all due to past actions;
In these seven days, cold and hot winds arise, and the channels for feces and urine are formed.
Here is the verse:
This body is wrapped in sinews and formed by various blood vessels,
Filled with impurities and rotten accumulations, washed by water and various leaking holes;
The heart is covered in vain, skillfully and deceitfully formed,
The mechanism is like a wooden man, very difficult to find.
For thirty-eight seven-day periods, the child is in the mother's womb. According to its past actions, a natural wind arises.
If the past actions are good, then a fragrant wind arises, making the body and mind comfortable and soft without flaws, straightening the bones and joints, making it upright and lovable by all.

If the past actions are evil, then a foul wind arises, making the body uncomfortable and the mind unhappy, blowing the bones and joints, making it hunchbacked and crooked, not upright, and unable to be a man, disliked by people.
This is for thirty-eight seven-day periods.
Four days before the ninth month is full, the child's body and bones are then complete and become a human.
Here is the verse:
A person in the body for nine months, then has all the bodily channels,
The bones and joints are all complete, full and lacking nothing.
Gradually provided for in the womb, gradually growing larger,
When the time comes, all are complete, like the fifteenth day of the month.
The child's body has two parts:
one part from the father, one part from the mother.
The hair, fur, cheeks, eyes, tongue, throat, heart, liver, spleen, kidneys, intestines, and blood, the soft parts, come from the mother;
the nails, teeth, bones, joints, marrow, brain, sinews, and vessels, the hard parts, come from the father.
Here is a verse:
The human body is connected, all born from parents,
The various joints and connections, formed by causes and conditions.
Depending on it to achieve complexion, all will become withered and exhausted,
Like a chariot built from various materials, the body is also like this when calculated.
There are two things in the front, the body is established like this,
Then only can it be born, depending on the retribution from parents.
The child in the mother's womb is below the liver and above the intestines. The male child faces inward with his back to the outside, on the left side;
the female child faces outward with her back to the mother, on the right side.

In a painful, foul-smelling, filthy place, all the bones and joints are contracted and cannot be extended. Wrapped in a leather bag, covered by the abdominal net, stained by blood, the place is cramped and confined, and the filth is like this.
For nine months, plus the remaining four days, if one has good conduct, on the first day and the last day, one thinks in one's mind:
I am in a garden or in heaven.
If one's conduct is evil, one thinks:
I am in the hells of the human world.

On the third day, one becomes sorrowful and unhappy. On the fourth day, a wind arises in the mother's womb, sometimes rising and sometimes descending, turning the child's body, hanging it upside down, with the head facing the birth canal.
Those with virtue will think to themselves:
I will jump into the bathing pool and play in the water, as if falling onto a high bed of flowers and fragrances!
Those without blessings will think to themselves:
I will fall from the mountain, into a ravine, ditch, or cesspool, or as if into hell, a net, a thorny wilderness, a rocky ravine, or among swords and halberds!
They will be sorrowful and unhappy.
The retribution of good and evil is not the same as this.
Here is the verse:
Like jumping into a burning fire, with chaotic smoke surrounding,
The result of indulgence leads to a place of boiling water.
The source of suffering and joy all comes from the formation of sin and merit,
Wherever one is born, the body one receives is like this.
When the child's body is about to be born and falls to the ground, blown by the external wind, touched by the woman's hand, washed with warm water, the pressing pain is like a wound.
Because of this suffering and fear of death, there is delusion and confusion, so one is bewildered and does not know where one originally came from or where one is going.

As soon as one is born on the ground, blood wraps the foul place, ghosts and spirits come to surround, one is possessed by lewdness, touched by a flying corpse, bewitched by sorcery and epilepsy ghosts, each waiting to violate.

It is like a piece of meat falling at a crossroads, crows, kites, vultures and wolves each come to fight over it. The evil ghosts and spirits wanting to take advantage of the child surround it in the same way.
Those with good past conduct are not taken advantage of by evil, but if one has evil past conduct, the many evils immediately attach.
When the child is first born, it is sustained by the mother's milk, and as it gradually grows, it is established by food.
Here is the verse:
While in the womb, one undergoes various sufferings and afflictions,
After birth, having become a human, one's pain is in the hundreds of thousands.
When the faculties are already complete, one emerges from the fragile body,
Having birth necessarily leads to old age and death, this is the most unreal.
When the child has grown up and is nourished by solid food, as soon as the body obtains the energy of grains, eighty kinds of worms are born in it.

One is called tongue-licking, the other is called heavy-licking.
Three kinds are on the head, called:
Firm, injured, and harmed.
One kind is in the brain, two kinds are on the surface of the brain:
One is called ink, the other is called wasting, the third is called confused.

One is called humble, the other is called rotten.
Two kinds are in the eyes:
One is called tongue-licking, the other is called heavy-licking.
Two kinds are in the ears:
The first is called tasting consciousness, and the second is called tasting the present.
Two are in the ear faculty:
The first is called red, and the second is called re-red.
Two are in the nose:
The first is called fat, and the second is called re-fat.
Two are in the mouth:
The first is called shaking, and the second is called shaking again.
Two are in the teeth:
The first is called evil and stubborn, and the second is called fierce and violent.
Three are in the roots of the teeth, called:
Panting, resting, and grabbing and pulling.ğŸ”½One is in the tongue, called sweet and delicious.
One is in the root of the tongue, called soft and tender.

One is in the throat, called gargle.

The first is called born, and the second is called unripe.
Two are in the shoulders:
The first is called hanging down, and the second is called hanging down again.
One is in the arm, called standing still.
One kind in the hands is called wandering.
Two kinds in the chest:
One is called forehead pit, the other is called broad.
One kind in the heart is called variegated.ğŸ”½One kind in the breasts is called showing milk.
One kind in the navel is called surrounding.
Two kinds in the ribs:
One is called moon, the other is called moon-faced.
Two kinds in the spine:
One is called moon-walking, the other is called moon-like.
One kind between the back and chest is called abundant.
One kind in the skin is called tiger's claws.
Two kinds in the flesh:
One is called consuming skin, the other is called burning tree.
Four kinds in the bones are called:
Very poisonous, habitual poison, fine bones, and mixed poison.
Five kinds in the marrow are called:
Killing, non-killing, destruction, separation from the body, and white bones.
Two kinds in the intestines:
One is called a dung beetle, and the other is called a dung beetle's mate.
Two kinds are in the small intestine:
One is called son, and the other is called grandson.

One kind is in the cooked entrails, called a sigh worm.
One kind is in the rectum, called a heavy-bodied worm.
Three kinds are in the feces, called:
Sinewy eyes, knotted eyes, and braided hair.
Two kinds are in the buttocks:
One is called flowing down, and the other is called heavy flow.
Five kinds are in the womb, called:
Clan, evil family, sleeping, unaware, and protecting the fluid.ğŸ”½One kind is in the thighs, called a whip worm.
One kind is in the knees, called a visible wound worm.ğŸ”½One kind is in the ankles, called a needle worm.ğŸ”½One kind is in the toes, called a burnt worm.
One kind is in the soles of the feet, called a skin-eater worm.
These are the eighty kinds of worms that dwell in the human body, feeding on it day and night.
Here is a verse:
From the hair down to the feet, worms throughout digest the person,
Contemplating them as impurities, likened to turbid water.
Born from oneself, they in turn harm themselves, like a sword, an enemy, or a calamity harming people,
Constantly coming to bite and injure the body, like flowing water eroding both banks.

In the person's body, wind-induced illnesses arise, with one hundred and one types. Cold, heat, and their combination each have one hundred and one, totaling four hundred and four illnesses in the human body.
Like wood producing fire, which then burns itself;
Illnesses are also like this, originating from the body, and then endangering the person.
And the eighty kinds of worms in the body disturb the body, making the person uneasy, let alone the afflictions of external sufferings!
Calculating the body in this way, there are always worries and troubles. Ordinary people consider themselves at ease, not hearing or understanding.
Why is this?
Because they do not see the truth.
In this verse it says:
Hair, body hair, nails, teeth, heart, flesh, skin, bones,ğŸ”½Semen, blood, cold and heat, marrow, brain, fat, cooked and raw food,
All cold, snot, tears, and sweat, constantly leaking urine and feces,
Impermanent, considered impure, the foolish consider it a treasure.
Calculating the human body, covered with thin skin, like a jujube or pomegranate, the skin is very thin and small!
Considering it a cover, people do not know. If the skin is removed like withered meat, how can it be called a human body?
The bones and joints support each other like a chain of iron locks. Seeing it this way is not enough to step on, let alone to be intimate with and look at with the eyes!
Then, with a verse, he praised and said:
Calculating the basis is a flaw, like a stinking rotten corpse,
Also like various dust and dirt, the body and worms are also like this;
Also like a painted likeness, will eventually return to decay,
Seeing the basis as originally non-existent with insight, how can it be approached?
Calculating that a person in the world commits misfortune and blessings, not exhausting their lifespan, there are also those who die prematurely and are injured.

It is like a potter making various earthenware vessels, some break at the beginning, some break when about to be trimmed with a knife, some break on the bricks, some break when being placed, some break when being placed on the ground, some break when being struck, some break when the clay is dry, some break when being baked, some break when finished, some break when being moved, some break when being used, even if not used, they will eventually break after a long time.

It is the same with people. Some have just begun to aspire to the Way but have not yet reached death, while some have two faculties like raw curd, some like ripe curd, some like flesh on bones, some like lumps of meat, with complete six faculties, some incomplete, and some who die;
Some are about to be born, some have just fallen to the ground;
Some die in infancy, some die at a hundred days, some at one year, some at ten years of age, while studying;
Some die at twenty, thirty, forty, or fifty, from one year of age until a hundred years old. Although they may live long, they will all eventually come to an end!

Thus, the five aggregates, when traced to their origins, are all empty. They depend on each other in succession, arising for a moment and ceasing for a moment. Whether raising or lowering the foot, they are all impermanent.
Foolish people, not hearing or knowing this, mistakenly think there is a body. From youth to old age, they all consider it as mine, calling it a single type, not knowing the changes of impermanence!
Those who practice the Way contemplate and reckon it thus: from this comes that, without this there is no that.
What is meant by from this comes that?
Because of the actions of the fundamental practices, one brings about misfortune and blessings, thus leading to death and staying in the middle.

Up to the embryo, the spirit resides in it, the form is like thin curd, breathing flesh, and gradually to solid flesh, having the six sense organs. When the six sense organs are complete, one is then born, from a young body to adulthood, and then to old age, sickness, and death. The five aggregates revolve in the wheel of birth and death, always like a flowing stream without rest. All are empty, like an illusion. In this way, one goes through old age, sickness, and death.
It is like a great city, the fire starts at the west gate and burns through to the east gate, all turning to ashes. The fire at the east gate is not the original fire!
Yet the burning is not separate from the original fire!
It is the same for humans. From the original causes and conditions, they follow their misfortune and blessings. One should observe that from this, there is this.

What is meant by if there is not, then there is not?ğŸ”½If there is no misfortune or blessing, and no other afflictions, then one does not return to death. Having not returned to death, one does not dwell in the middle. If there is no dwelling in the middle, how can there be birth?
If there is no birth, how can there be old age, sickness, and death?
The beginning and end of the flow of birth and death are calculated like this. Those who practice the Way should observe the formation and destruction of the five aggregates.

Clearly understanding the meaning of wisdom, the mind is pure like the full moon,

Like a lotus flower in the water, sweet, soft, and supreme,
What is spoken from the mouth, the listener then happily understands.
